Other:
6 month waitlist
Able to lift 25-40 lbs

Description: Organize food at the warehouse with your family
Distribute food to children and families at the end of the school day.
Hours available: Weekday afternoons. Exact days and times vary.

Description: Deliver 1 week's worth of food to homebound seniors and those with disabilities.
Commitment: Medium. 6 months, 3 deliveries/month. Sometimes one-time delivery opportunities are available.
Hours available: M-Sa (no Sunday). Call clients to arrange delivery times.
Other: Recommend 2 volunteers. Can bring children on deliveries if clients agree.

Description: Decorate 20-40 boxes that will be used for food box delivery to homebound seniors and those with disabilities.
Help refugee young adults (ages 15-24) adapt to live in Salt Lake City and be successful.
Ensure refugee tax payers have all info and documents necessary to complete their tax return.
Provide free, professional tax preparation service to refugees.
Other: No professional experience required, but must take training from both IRC and IRS to become certified.

Description: Provide basic academic and technology support for refugee students (k-12th grade)
Other:
Training happenes near beginning of school year.

Volunteers will be matched with a specific family to work with over the long term.

Description: Help drive refugees to medical appointments, locate their doctor, and process paperwork.
Hours available: Varies based on appointment times - typically weekdays 7:30am-6pm.
